column4: What is the default unit of measurement of storage size in the du command? I could not find the answer in 'man du' version 5.97 (September 2007).
bullgard4, du -ha is an answer but not the answer to the question that I have put.
it's in bytes like everything in unix
Thank you very much for your help.
that is what type of encapsulation the packets have, typically Ethernet.  or Local loopback

I do not understand you very well. What does 'Link encap: Ethernet' mean? That the packets flowing through this interface are encapsulated in Ethernet frames? And what does ' Link encap:Local Loopback ' mean then?
it doesnt really matter - what is not working for you?
In contrast to your opinion it does matter. --  My T42 does not thaw properly after resuming it in a local Ubuntu club and thawing it in my LAN at home.
In contrast to your opinion it does matter. --  My T42 does not thaw properly after hibernating it in a local Ubuntu club and thawing it in my LAN at home.
that is a condensation/electrical issue and has nothing to do with the encapsulation
Your Linux education is insufficient. --  Thanks for a nice try.
guaranteed your problem has nothing to do with link encap.
